Suspect Class.definition: a class of individuals marked by immutable characteristics
Suspect Class.origin: [a classification that does not impact a suspect class or impinge upon a fundamental constitutional right will be upheld if it is rationally related to a legitimate government interest " Doe v. Poritz , 622 A.2d 367 (1995)"]

1.1: a class of individuals marked by immutable characteristics (as of race or national origin) and entitled to equal protection of the law by means of judicial scrutiny of a classification that discriminates against or otherwise burdens or affects them [a classification that does not impact a
1.note: Suspect classandsuspect classificationare often used synonymously in regard to a group of persons, butsuspect classdoes not refer to the process of classifying itself.
